Ingest_LDD.name: New Horizons Primary and Extended Missions Dictionary
Ingest_LDD.comment:
This dictionary is in development by multiple parties at UMD (NH migration) and SWRI (NH second extended mission). Async releases are anticipated to keep the published dictionary in line with published data.
Initials/handles: ACR Anne Raugh, SBN at UMD AGB Adeline Gicquel-Brodtke, SBN at UMD BJH Ben Hirsch, SBN at UMD cgobat Caden Gobat, SwRI MKC M. Kate Crombie, Indigo Information Systems, LLC
=======
Modification History:
2024-04-03 ACR Begin history
=== Version 1.1.0.0 ===
2024-04-03 to 2024-04-05 Version 1.1.0 continued updates: ACR Deprecate MVIC_Conversion_Constants class in favor of Radiometric_Conversion_Constants class, with corresponding Schematron rule. Consistently add "nh:" prefix to references in descriptions. Review definitions for completeness, consistency, and style; flag problems. 2024-06-15 ACR Manually resolved conflicts resulting from multiple people editing the the same parts of the file in separate branches. Convert all occurrences of the name to "Alice". Split "scan_type" attribute definition into two occurences, one for MVIC and one for LEISA, to accommodate different permissible value lists. Modified LEISA_Details class definition to not refer to "channels".
2024-06-20 Added schematron rule to enforce correct units for resolved vs. cgobat unresolved sources in nh:units_of_conversion_constants; updated several attribute descriptions and removed [INCOMPLETE] and [CHECK] flags; removed "Spectrograph" as a permissible value for nh:detector_type; added a minimum value of absolute zero for LEISA temperature attribute; added the SOCC to the list of permissible Alice aperture values; removed nh:binning_mode attribute and its parent class nh:LORRI_Details (of which it was the only member).

DD_Attribute.name: aperture
DD_Attribute.definition: The Alice instrument has two different apertures (i.e., optical paths) through which it can collect data: the "airglow" aperture and the solar occultation channel (SOCC). The nh:aperture attribute indicates which was used for a given data product.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The data were collected through Alice's airglow aperture.
The data were obtained via Alice's solar occultation channel (SOCC).

DD_Attribute.name: approx_target_name
DD_Attribute.definition:
The nh:approx_target_name attribute is the best guess of the intended target of the observation made by the automated data processing pipeline.
If the best guess at the target is unknown, the attribute will be UNK i.e. unknown. If there was no target, i.e. for some instances of instrument calibration activities, the attribute will be nilled.

DD_Attribute.name: approx_target_line
DD_Attribute.definition:
The nh:approx_target_line attribute provides the approximate pixel position in the image of the center of the best guess target (as specified by nh:approx_target_name) in one-based absolute units along the "Line" axis as defined in the primary_image Array object. The origin is in the lower left of the image when disp:horizontal_display_direction is "Left to Right" and disp:vertical_display_direction is "Bottom to Top".
If there is no best guess at the target position, the attribute will be omitted.

DD_Attribute.name: approx_target_sample
DD_Attribute.definition:
The nh:approx_target_sample attribute provides the approximate pixel position in the image of the center of the best guess target (as specified by nh:approx_target_name) in one-based absolute units along the "Sample" axis as defined in the primary_image Array object. The origin is in the lower left of the image when disp:horizontal_display_direction is "Left to Right" and disp:vertical_display_direction is "Bottom to Top".
If there is no best guess at the target position, the attribute will be omitted.

DD_Attribute.name: arrokoth_constant
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:arrokoth_constant attribute supplies the constant to be used for sources with spectral distribution similar to (486958) Arrokoth (a.k.a., 2014 MU69) to convert calibrated data to physical units.

DD_Attribute.name: charon_constant
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:charon_constant attribute supplies the constant to be used for sources with spectral distribution similar to Pluto I (Charon) to convert calibrated data to physical units.

DD_Attribute.name: clock_partition
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:clock_partition holds the mission clock partition counter. This is a simple integer.

DD_Attribute.name: detector_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:detector_name provides the identifier of the detector that recorded the observation(s) comprising the product. For instruments with multiple detectors, as in the case of MVIC, for example, this string will include both the instrument ID and the specific detector ID.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Data were obtained using the RALPH/LEISA infrared detector with a waveleght range of 1250 - 2500 nm.
Data were obtained using the blue channel detector. The blue filter covers the range 400-550nm.
Data were obtained using the narrow band methane (CH4) channel detector. The CH4 filter covers the range 860-910nm
Data were obtained using the panchromatic framing array. The filter over the framing array is clear; the coverage range is 400-975nm.
Data were obtained using the Near IR channel detector. The NIR filter covers the range 780-975nm.
Data were obtained using the panchromatic channel 1 (one) detector. The filter over the panchromatic detectors is clear; the coverage range is 400-975nm.
Data were obtained using the panchromatic channel 2 (two) detector. The filter over the panchromatic detectors is clear; the coverage range is 400-975nm.
Data were obtained using the red channel detector. The red filter covers the range 540-700nm.

Data were obtained using the Alice spectrograph. The Alice UV spectrograph has a spectral passband of 520-1870 Angstrom, a spectral PSF of 3-6 Angstrom FWHM, and an instantaneous spatial field of view that is 6 degrees long.
Data were obtained using the LORRI imager. LORRI is a high-resolution panchromatic imager with a spectral passband of 350-850 nm.

DD_Permissible_Value.value: Pluto Energetic Particles Spectrometer Science Investigation
DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Data were obtained using the PEPSSI time-of-flight (TOF) spectrometer that measures ions and electrons over a broad range of energies and pitch angles.
Data were obtained using the REX subsystem comprising the 2.1 m spacecraft high-gain antenna (HGA) and the NH radio receiver as well as the the Deep Space Network (DSN).
Data were obtained using the SDC dust imapact counter.
Data were obtained using the SWAP electrostatic analyzer.

DD_Attribute.name: detector_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:detector_type attribute provides a brief indication of the type of hardware comprising the detector.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The detector is a standard CCD.
The detector is a set of permanently polarized Polyvinylidene Fluoride (PVDF) plastic films that generate an electrical signal when dust particles penetrate their surface.
The detector is an electrostatic low-energy plasma instrument.
The detector is a modified HgCdTe 'PICNIC' array from Rockwell Scientific Imaging.

DD_Permissible_Value.value: Local oscillator vs. uplink signal phase comparator
DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The detector is a local oscillator vs. uplink signal phase comparator.
The detector is a Microchannel plate (MCP) which is sensitive to extreme and far UV light and energetic particles.
The detector is a solid-state silicon detector.

DD_Attribute.name: frame_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:frame_number attribute is used to identify a single frame (or image plane) in an observation that is formatted as a 3D image cube. The first frame is numbered "0" (zero).

DD_Attribute.name: gain
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:gain attribute provides the gain setting applied in collecting the data, in units of electrons/DN.

DD_Attribute.name: gc_scan_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:gc_scan_rate attribute provides the scan rate requested of the Guidance, Navigation, and Control (GNC) system by the Ralph instrument. If the scan rate was not forced, GNC will return the actual scan rate achieved.

DD_Attribute.name: jupiter_constant
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:jupiter_constant attribute supplies the constant to be used for sources with spectral distribution similar to Jupiter to convert calibrated data to physical units.

DD_Attribute.name: left_side_median_bias
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:left_side_median_bias attribute provides the median bias, in DN, determined by averaging the bias levels for the shielded pixels on the left side of the detector array.

DD_Attribute.name: leisa_mode
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:leisa_mode attribute identifies the data collection readout mode of the LEISA instrument, where RAW is for un-subtracted readout mode and SUBTRACTED for correlated double sample (CDS) mode.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The LEISA readout mode is un-subtracted.
The LEISA readout mode is subtracted.

DD_Attribute.name: leisa_offset_1
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:leisa_offset_1 attribute provides the voltage offset, in DN, in the first of the four LEISA quadrants.

DD_Attribute.name: leisa_offset_2
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:leisa_offset_2 attribute provides the voltage offset, in DN, in the second of the four LEISA quadrants.

DD_Attribute.name: leisa_offset_3
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:leisa_offset_3 attribute provides the voltage offset, in DN, in the third of the four LEISA quadrants.

DD_Attribute.name: leisa_offset_4
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:leisa_offset_4 attribute provides the voltage offset, in DN, in the fourth of the four LEISA quadrants.

DD_Attribute.name: leisa_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:leisa_rate attribute provides the time between LEISA readouts. There is zero dead time between frames, so in practice, this value is equivalent to the per-frame exposure time, and the number of frames per second is exactly its reciprocal.

DD_Attribute.name: leisa_side
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:leisa_side attribute indicates the hardware side in use during the observation sequence.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The LEISA "A" hardware side.
The LEISA "B" hardware side.

DD_Attribute.name: leisa_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:leisa_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the LEISA instrument.

DD_Attribute.name: met510
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:met510 attribute provides the mission elapsed time (MET) of the Ralph housekeeping packet (ApID 0x510) that marks the start of an observation, used to determine the observation start time and frame rate.

DD_Attribute.name: mission_phase_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:mission_phase_name provides the formal identification of the mission phase. Phases are identified continuously from primary through extended missions.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: New Horizons Kuiper Belt Extended Mission 1 (KEM1) Cruise phase
New Horizons Kuiper Belt Extended Mission 1 (KEM1) Encounter
New Horizons Kuiper Belt Extended Mission 2 (KEM2) Cruise phase

DD_Attribute.name: observation_description
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:observation_description element provides a human-readable decoding of the sequence_id string. It provides a basic description of the planned observation activity. Each instrument should have an accompanying ancillary/documentation file that lists all the planned sequences for each instrument for each mission phase.

DD_Attribute.name: pholus_constant
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:pholus_constant attribute supplies the constant to be used for sources with spectral distribution similar to (5145) Pholus to convert calibrated data to physical units.

DD_Attribute.name: physical_pixel_size
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:physical_pixel_size attribute gives the hardware dimension of a single, square pixel within the detector.

DD_Attribute.name: pivot_wavelength
DD_Attribute.definition:
The nh:pivot_wavelength is used in converting the pixel values in the calibrated data into physical units for some instruments. It is wavelength-dependent, but once defined is constant for each detector.
A description of how to convert from data values to physical units is provided in the "New Horizons SOC to Instrument Pipeline ICD" document.

DD_Attribute.name: pluto_constant
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:pluto_constant attribute supplies the constant to be used for sources with spectral distribution similar to (134340) Pluto to convert calibrated data to physical units.

DD_Attribute.name: pointing_method
DD_Attribute.definition:
The nh:pointing_method attribute indicates the spacecraft pointing method enabled during the operational sequence.
Possible enumerated values are 'CB1', 'CB2', 'CB3', 'EARTH', 'SUN' or 'ORBIT NORMAL', which describe the body or plane used to establish a reference frame onboard the spacecraft for pointing purposes (where 'CB' stands for central body). Alternatively, this value can take the form 'RADEC=[X],[Y]' (where [X] and [Y] represent a numeric right ascension and declination in degrees, respectively) to indicate inertial pointing.
This value does *not* indicate that any particular axis of the spacecraft is aligned with the target or direction indicated by the pointing method. This attribute is not applicable if nh:spacecraft_spin_state is 'Spinning'.

DD_Attribute.name: read_noise
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:read_noise attribute provides the noise level of the detector as a count of electrons.

DD_Attribute.name: relative_control_mode_active
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:relative_control_mode_active attribute is a true/false flag that indicates if the relative control mode of the spacecraft was enabled during the operational sequence.

DD_Attribute.name: right_side_median_bias
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:right_side_median_bias attribute provides the median bias, in DN, determined by averaging the bias levels for the shielded pixels on the right side of the detector array.

DD_Attribute.name: scan_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:scan_type attribute indicates what sort of scanning was employed in collecting the data.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The data were obtained using time delayed integration (TDI). The TDI frequency should be provided in the tdi_rate attribute.
The data were obtained as a sequence of 2D image frames.

DD_Attribute.name: scan_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:scan_type attribute indicates what sort of scanning was employed in collecting the data.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The data were obtained as a sequence of LEISA frames.

DD_Attribute.name: sequence_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:sequence_id provides a long string encoding some infomation about the planned observing sequence. A more human-readable description should be provided in the nh:observation_description element. Each instrument should have an accompanying ancillary/documentation file that lists all the planned sequences for each instrument for each mission phase.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_constant
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:solar_constant attribute supplies the constant to be used for sources with spectral distribution similar to the Sun to convert MVIC calibrated data to physical units.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_spin_state
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:spacecraft_spin_state attribute indicates which of the spacecraft spin states was employed during the observation sequence.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The spacecraft is actively controlling its pointing in all 3 axes.
The spacecraft is maintaining pointing stability by spinning about one of its axes.

DD_Attribute.name: start_clock_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:start_clock_count is the Mission Elapsed Time code at the start of the observation(s), formatted as spacecraft clock ticks and indicating whole and fractional seconds.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_clock_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:stop_clock_count is the Mission Elapsed Time code at the end of the observation(s), formatted as spacecraft clock ticks and indicating whole and fractional seconds.

DD_Attribute.name: sweep_samples_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:sweep_samples_count attribute is the count of samples during a sweep of the SWAP electro-optics.

DD_Attribute.name: target_motion_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: [INCOMPLETE] The nh:target_motion_rate attribute is the rate of motion of the target with respect to the instrument detector in units of (TBR).

DD_Attribute.name: tdi_median_bias_level
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:tdi_median_bias_level attribute gives the median bias level of a time-delay integration observation. For TDI mode, bias levels in each detector were determined in-flight during early mission phases. They may vary depending on exposure length. See the "New Horizonz SOC to Instrument Pipeline ICD" document for details.

DD_Attribute.name: tdi_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:tdi_rate attribute is the rate at which charge was moved through successive rows of the detector in obtaining the observation. This rate was calculated to match the scan rate of the spacecraft.

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_apid
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:telemetry_apid is the application identifier for the observation. The values are specific to instrument and activity. The definitions for apIDs relevant to the archived observations are contained in various tables in the "New Horizons SOC to Instrument Pipeline ICD document. The apID is used in formulating the file name, among other things. Metadata encoded in the apID is contained in separate metadata elements elsewhere in the label.

DD_Attribute.name: thruster_x_enabled
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:thruster_x_enabled attribute describes the state of the x thruster. The thruster is either enabled ('true') or disabled ('false').

DD_Attribute.name: thruster_y_enabled
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:thruster_y_enabled attribute describes the state of the y thruster. The thruster is either enabled ('true') or disabled ('false').

DD_Attribute.name: thruster_z_enabled
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:thruster_z_enabled attribute describes the state of the z thruster. The thruster is either enabled ('true') or disabled ('false').

DD_Attribute.name: hk_packet_is_real
DD_Attribute.definition: The nh:hk_packet_is_real attribute describes whether the Ralph housekeeping packet (ApID 0x510) is real (true) or assumed from a gap (false).

DD_Attribute.name: units_of_conversion_constants
DD_Attribute.definition:
The calibrated data are not converted to physical units, because the conversion applied depends on the general spectrum of the object being converted and whether it is resolved. For resolved sources, the conversion produces data in units of radiance. For unresolved sources, the conversion results in units of flux (irradiance). The nh:units_of_conversion_constants attribute contains the appropriate physical units for the conversion constants in the class in which it is contained to produce either radiance or flux units, as appropriate, when the conversion is applied.
A description of how to convert from data values to physical units is provided in the "New Horizons SOC to Instrument Pipeline ICD" document.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Units for conversion factors for unresolved sources, to produce units of flux (irradiance)
Units for conversion factors for resolved sources, to produce units of radiance.

DD_Class.name: Detector
DD_Class.definition: The nh:Detector class provides observation metadata relevant to the specific detector (an instrument may have more than one detector) used to collect the data.

DD_Class.name: Mission_Elapsed_Time
DD_Class.definition: The nh:Mission_Elapsed_Time class provides spacecraft clock partition and count readings for the start and end of the observation(s) comprising the data product.

DD_Class.name: Frame_Bias_Levels
DD_Class.definition:
The nh:Frame_Bias_Levels class records the frame number and left/right bias levels for a single frame in a framing observation sequence.
In the MVIC detector used for framing observations, the bias level for left and right sides of the detector may vary. Bias levels on each side are measured with every observation through shielded pixels on either side of the detector, the bias values for the pixels from each side them being averaged to return a single median bias level for each side of the detector. These bias levels are reported as left and right median bias levels for each frame.

DD_Class.name: Framing_Biases
DD_Class.definition: The nh:Framing_Biases class contains one nh:Frame_Bias_Levels class for each individual frame of a framing observation. These classes provide the left and right side bias levels applied in calibrating the data.

DD_Class.name: LORRI_Target_Information
DD_Class.definition: The nh:LORRI_Target_Information class collects attributes related to the target of the LORRI observation.

DD_Class.name: MVIC_Calibration_Information
DD_Class.definition: The nh:MVIC_Calibration_Information class gathers attributes related to the attributes of the detector and other information relevant to the calibration processing performed to produce the current data product.

DD_Class.name: MVIC_Conversion_Constants
DD_Class.definition:
This class is deprecated as of version 1.1.0.0. Please use nh:Radiometric_Conversion_Constants instead.
The nh:MVIC_Conversion_Constants class provides the values needed to run the conversion from the calibrated pixel values to physical units. This conversion is dependent on the spectral distribition of the source, the MVIC detector wavelength range, and whether or not the source is resolved.
A description of how to convert from data values to physical units is provided in the "New Horizons SOC to Instrument Pipeline ICD" document.

DD_Class.name: Radiometric_Conversion_Constants
DD_Class.definition:
The nh:Radiometric_Conversion_Constants class provides the values needed to run the conversion from the calibrated pixel values to physical units. This conversion is dependent on the spectral distribition of the source, the detector wavelength range, and whether or not the source is resolved.
A description of how to convert from data values to physical units is provided in the "New Horizons SOC to Instrument Pipeline ICD" document.

DD_Class.name: LEISA_Details
DD_Class.definition: The nh:LEISA_Details class collects observational parameters that are specific to the LEISA instrument.

DD_Class.name: MVIC_Details
DD_Class.definition: The nh:MVIC_Details class collects observational parameters that are specific to the MVIC instrument and its various channels.

DD_Class.name: Alice_Details
DD_Class.definition: The Alice_Details class collects observational parameters that are specific to the Alice instrument.

DD_Class.name: Observation_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The nh:Observation_Parameters class collects observational metadata that is specific to the mission, spacecraft, and instrument which produced the data product.

DD_Class.name: Ralph_Details
DD_Class.definition: The nh:Ralph_Details class presents Ralph common instrument parameters needed for data calibration.

DD_Class.name: Resolved_Source
DD_Class.definition: The nh:Resolved_Source class presents radiometric conversion constants for converting calibrated pixel values into physical units for sources which are resolved.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_State
DD_Class.definition: The nh:Spacecraft_State class collects observational parameters that are specific to the spacecraft state at the time of the observation.

DD_Class.name: SWAP_Details
DD_Class.definition: The nh:SWAP_Details class collects observational parameters that are specific to the SWAP instrument.

DD_Class.name: Unresolved_Source
DD_Class.definition: The nh:Unresolved_Source class presents radiometric conversion constants for converting calibrated pixel values into physical units for sources which are not resolved.

DD_Class.name: Mission_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The nh:Mission_Parameters class presents the various New Horizons-specific metadata for both primary and extended missions.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: In nh:MVIC_Details, the TDI rate must be provided for TDI scans when processing level is partially processed (calibrated).
In nh:MVIC_Details, if pds:processing_level is not partially processed, then tdi_rate cannot be included.

As of version 1.1 of the New Horizons mission dictionary, the MVIC_Conversion_Constants class is deprecated. Please use the Radiometric_Conversion_Constants class for all instruments supplying this information.
The units of the radiometric conversion constants for a resolved source should be (DN/s)/(erg/cm^2/s/Angstrom/sr).
The units of the radiometric conversion constants for an unresolved source should be (DN/s)/(erg/cm^2/s/Angstrom).

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if (starts-with(//nh:MVIC_Details/nh:scan_type,'TDI')) then (nh:tdi_median_bias_level and not(nh:Framing_Biases)) else (nh:Framing_Biases and not(nh:tdi_median_bias_level))
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: In MVIC_Calibration_Information, TDI scans data must include the attribute nh:tdi_median_bias_level; framing observations must include the nh:Framing_Biases class; both should never used together.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if (nh:approx_target_name/@xsi:nil eq 'true') then not(nh:approx_target_line) else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: If nh:approx_target_name is nilled, then nh:approx_target_line must not be present.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if (nh:approx_target_name/@xsi:nil eq 'true') then not(nh:approx_target_sample) else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: If nh:approx_target_name is nilled, then nh:approx_target_sample must not be present.
